subject: Philosophy
title: The Turing Test
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Turing Test.

hook.text: Alan Turing proposed a test: if a machine fools you into thinking it's human, call it intelligent.

buildup.text: In 1950, he asked: instead of debating 'can machines think,' let's test if they can imitate thinking.

discovery.text: If you chat with a machine and can't tell it's not human, the machine passes the test.

twist.text: Modern chatbots can fool many people. But critics say imitation isn't understanding â€” it's performance.

climax.text: The Turing Test measures behavior, not consciousness. A machine could pass it and still be empty inside.

punchline.text: Acting smart and being smart might be very different things.

quiz.question: What does the Turing Test actually measure?
options: Whether a machine can imitate human conversation
Whether a machine is truly conscious
